docs.lead_paragraph: Not long ago I suggested that frail, elderly patients write “Do Less” across their foreheads with a Sharpie, but I’m rethinking that. Two other words might serve better: “comfort” and “function.”
docs.abstract: A doctor urges health care providers to think harder about whether a medical procedure will improve an elderly patient’s comfort and function.
docs.snippet: A doctor urges health care providers to think harder about whether a medical procedure will improve an elderly patient’s comfort and function.

keywords.value: Bitter Pill, A: How the Medical System Is Failing the Elderly (Book)
keywords.name: unknown

docs.lead_paragraph: Thinking Cap offers reports from the world of ideas.
docs.abstract: Along with the familiar criticisms of the culture’s obsession with thinness, Ms. Kwan and Ms. Trautner would like to see Congress pass a law that bans discrimination against fat people.
docs.snippet: Along with the familiar criticisms of the culture’s obsession with thinness, Ms. Kwan and Ms. Trautner would like to see Congress pass a law that bans discrimination against fat people.

docs.lead_paragraph: Government heath officials are warning that gonorrhea, one of the most common sexually transmitted diseases, is becoming increasingly resistant to the last type of antibiotics left to treat it.

docs.lead_paragraph: Juggling parental concern with an adolescent patient’s legal and ethical right to privacy opens up some tricky questions.

docs.lead_paragraph: The medical establishment is seeing addiction more as a physical disease, and 10 medical schools have introduced residency programs in addiction medicine.
